text: Australian police surround a cafe in the
centre of Sydney where a gunman is
holding staff and customers hostage five
people have managed to escape police say
negotiators are in contact with the
gunman the motive of the gunman is
unclear but earlier a black flag with
Arabic writing was placed on the cafes
window the major priority is a safe
resolution to this where nobody
including the hostage taker gets hurt
that is the ideal solution and one of
the reasons that the the the police
commissioner doesn't want to speculate
too much is because given what you
report earlier it's very clear that the
hostage taker is interested in media
coverage and one of the major things
that we want to do is hostage
negotiators control the flow of
information in and out of the siege
location so if other people are calling
in or if the media is complicating
things it could really make it very
difficult for the negotiators to do
their job and to try to reach a safe
outcome we've been seeing some pictures
there are some of the hostages who have
been released presumably they may be in
a position to tell the police a few
clues as to who the gunman is what his
demands are and what a state of mind is
that's right but you can't really rely
on that very much because it's unclear
well at least from my understanding it's
unclear how long they were held so how
long did they have to gather any of this
information we still don't know exactly
the reason why they would let go was it
because they were ill or was it for some
other reason we don't know why they why
they were chosen or whether they were
able to escape in the chaos of the
initial take oke
